QuestionTxt: In many countries, big companies are allowed to work out with each other how much they will produce, what price they will charge, and how they will meet consumer demand. In the United States, our antitrust laws prohibit companies in the same industry from getting together to discuss these kinds of things. Do you think it does more good than harm or more harm than good to make it illegal for big companies in the same industry to get together for these purposes?
